result.title: Third update status report on JPI HDHL performance in social media
result.description: This deliverable is a summary of the output of task 5.3. It concerns a short status report on the JPI HDHL activities related to social media performed in the fourth reporting period of the CSA JPI HDHL 2.0. The report describes the activities on various social media platforms and the reach and impact through these activities.

result.title: Report on the evaluation on the funding activities
result.description: This deliverable is the output of task 6.2. The report will be based on an analysis of the data provided by H2020 funded ERA HDHL which deals with the monitoring and evaluation of consortia funded through the Joint Actions of JPI HDHL and ERA HDHL. The aim of this task is to analyse the gathered data towards the aims and ambitions mentioned in the strategic document.

result.title: Summary of the efforts to twin regions with a strong mining heritage
result.description: A report summarising the effort to twin regions with a strong mining heritage (for example Saxony and Cornwall and Lapland). Aim is to twin both mines and the residents of mining regions and ultimately better connect these different groups with complementary and overlapping interests.

result.title: Report on the fourth Process evaluation of JPI HDHL
result.description: This deliverable is the second output of task 6.3.2 and concerns a report on the fourth performed process evaluation of JPI HDHL. The first and second process evaluation took place during the course of the first CSA of JPI HDHL according to a developed framework which was designed through a collaboration of JPIs established through the finalised FP7 project JPIs to Cowork. The process evaluation will follow the updated evaluation framework - which results out of task 6.1.

result.title: Report on the evaluation of the impact of JPI HDHL
result.description: This deliverable is part of task 6.4. The deliverable will be a report on the overall impact of JPI HDHL and takes place roughly ten year after the start of JPI HDHL. The evaluation will build on the already developed framework which is used and/or updated in the other tasks of WP6.
